column6: I LOVED this hotel!  This was our first time at Disneyland Paris, and we LOVED our stay here and the experience of DLP.  The hotel is exceptional!  I have stayed at many WDW hotels and this one is one of my favorites as far as the room and the theming and fun details of all aspects of the hotel.  The location to the parks and the shopping and restaurant area (it's like a mini-Disney Springs that you walk through to get to the entrance of both parks) was fantastic.  We had a first-floor room (Spiderman floor- each floor was a different superhero theme!) so we were able to just walk out our patio to go to the parks.  The AMAZING attention to theming detail of Marvel just blew me away! A showcase of 3 full-sized Iron Man suits and another of 3 Capt. America shields!!!! WOW!! They even pipe in a subtle and lovely aroma perfumed scent throughout the lobbies that greets you upon entering (which you can buy a bottle of in the gift shop of course!).  The rooms were exceptional big especially when compared to most hotel rooms in Europe. We were a party of 4 adults, and we did not feel cramped. We used the indoor pool- it was nice- but it closes at 10:00 which is early if you're gone all day. There is also a cool kid's activity room that looked like it would be fun for little ones. The bar is themed like you're at the top of the Avenger's NYC skyscraper! We had dinner in the main dining room.  It was good tasting buffet food, good variety and it was presented with great Disney/Marvel flair. Vegetables, potatoes, and a few main dishes were cut out in mickey ears which was fun, the drinks were all Marvel hero themed and the desert bar!!! oh my goodness- that was the highlight!!! So many different kind of Marvel themed beautiful deserts- it was hard to choose.  They VERY MUCH need to build a 2nd hotel just like this one in Florida so I can stay there again! This hotel is too great to just have it in just one location.
column7: The main difference between this hotel and ones in Florida is that it didn't offer a cafeteria style meal option room for a faster and less expensive "grab and go self-service" type of restaurant. If you were staying multiple days at this hotel, I would think you'd want the faster, easier, less expensive, more food options and more casual type of cafeteria style restaurant option like they have in most of the hotels at Disney World. You don't always want a sit down/waiter service restaurant- especially if you're traveling with kids. The only other little con is that while it was great to have an indoor pool, the hours need to be a little longer.  The hot tubs closed at 9:45 and the pool at 10:00. If you're in the park til close and then eat dinner or shop by the time you walk back to the hotel that leaves little time to get ready and go down to enjoy the pool/hot tub after a long day. We got down there at 9:30 and settled in the hot tub and after only 10 minutes they were kicking us out! bummer
